definition: lit. eating away next year's food in advance/fig. to dip into the next month's check/live now, pay later
3rd earthly branch: 3-5 a.m., 1st solar month (4th February-5th March), year of the Tiger/ancient Chinese compass point: 60°
variant of 吃[chi1]
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
old variant of 卯[mao3]

mortise (slot cut into wood to receive a tenon)/4th earthly branch: 5-7 a.m., 2nd solar month (6th March-4th April), year of the Rabbit/ancient Chinese compass point: 90° (east)/variant of 鉚|铆[mao3]/to exert one's strength
variant of 卯[mao3]
grain/food/provisions/agricultural tax paid in grain

sentences.english: Give me your credit cards. You're living beyond your means.
sentences.chinese: 把你的信用卡给我，你花钱总是寅吃卯粮的。

sentences.english: But a bailout harms the citizens of these other countries, who did not live beyond their means.
sentences.chinese: 但援助对其他国家尚未寅吃卯粮的国民有害。

definition: income does not cover expenditure/unable to make ends meet
to assess one's income and spend accordingly (idiom); to live within one's means/You can only spend what you earn.

definition: lit. to drain the pond to get at the fish (idiom)/fig. to kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
